Reviews.Title: “Looking for best location and honest price?”
Reviews.Author: Georgia C
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a convenient, well located hotelin Paris, Des Carmes is a good option. First, the location is a must: boulevard St Germain, walking distance from the best spots of Paris. Another benefit: they don´t change the price along the year – holidays, events, etc. But, book in advance. The drawbacks: the room is small and there is no cooler. So, you can´t buy a Champagne for a reasonable price in put in a refrigerator. BUT, if you buy it in the front grocery, you may ask them to chill it for you :)

Reviews.Title: “Delightful, well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: bac48
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Hotel des Carmes in the Latin Quarter of Paris and we were once again delighted with this lovely 2 star hotel. It is very well located, quiet (on a one way street), 1 minute walk to nearest metro (Maubert Matualite) lots of cafes and restaurants, a supermarket and laundry nearby. We stayed 6 nights and found to staff to be friendly and professional. They spoke English but were patient and encouraging when we attempted to converse in our limited French. Our room had a street view with the Pantheon up the road and Bd. Saint-Germain at the other end. Very easy to walk to Notre Dame just across the river. They have free internet access and can organise an airport shuttle. We plan to stay again on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel des Carmes”
Reviews.Author: Claudio G
Reviews.Content: A nice budget hotel not to be in during the month of July: too hot, without air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place!”
Reviews.Author: mattanda
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the last leg of our Europe trip from a recommendation of friends and we loved it! Staff we so lovely and helpful, area was beautiful to walk around, 5 mins from Notre Dame. Stayed in a Superior room with a street view, and it was very roomy and comfortable! Very quiet at night for a comfortable sleep. Overall a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “My choice hotel at Latin Quarter.....”
Reviews.Author: sgmunchies
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this charming hotel for 3 nights - 2 nights in a room with street view and 1 night at courtyard. I like the streetview room best - with uphill view to the magnificent Pantheon and downhill view with shops leading to Notre Dame. The rooms are basic, clean and the price is reasonable. Wifi is free, and most importantly, the staff on the front desk are always very friendly and always ready to offer us help with great recommendations! On our last day, we had to leave very early at 6.30am, while waiting for the taxi to pick us up, the staff even offer us a cup of coffee, a nice gesture that warm our hearts! We also love the location - 5minutes walk to nearest metro which bring you to all sightseeing places, walking distance to the beautiful Luxembourg Gardens, Sainte-Chapelle, Louvre etc etc., wide variety of restaurants and eateries in the Latin Quarter (even at late night). what more can one ask for...... I will definitely be staying at Hotel Des Carmes again when I go back to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous little hotel right in the thick of the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: GFMVHAC
Reviews.Content: I booked Hotel des Carmes on the recommendation of a friend who had stayed there over 10yrs ago and I wasn't disappointed. Our room was cosy but clean and with air-conditioning. If I have one complaint it would be there was no mini bar in our room which would've been handy to put our food in. The staff were extremely friendly and went out of their way to provide recommendations for dinner and sight seeing spots. We even saved ourselves an expensive taxi fare to the train station on the advice to catch the bus instead - which all worked out fine. This hotel is nothing fancy but if you're looking for a quiet well run place to rest your head close to everything including one of Paris's best cheese shop then I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Always great stay here”
Reviews.Author: skhs75
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel -- clean reasonable, helpful people at front desk and terrific location. What more can you ask for.

Reviews.Title: “A return visit - still highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: 1013WesternRanger
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel since the first in October 2009 and once again we were very impressed with the cleanliness, friendliness of the staff and the great location. All I want from a hotel is is a clean, quiet, comfortable room and I had all of these at Hotel des Carmes. I don't stay at hotels for the view as I would rather be out there enjoying it but our 5th floor room did have a great view from the balcony of the Pantheon up the hill to the south and the top of Notre Dame behind the shops to the north. The bathroom was excellent, air conditioning in the room for when the weather warms up and a small lift to save your legs on the stairs. Good value breakfasts at only 6€.

Reviews.Title: “a little treasure”
Reviews.Author: louise_dufresne
Reviews.Content: I spent 7 nights in late Sept. 2010 and was absolutly charmed. The staff was very friendly and helpful from the receptionist to the cleaning ladies. Luc was able to give all kinds of interesting info on places to visit. The location could not be better: 5mn walking to Notre-Dame, no more than 10 mn to the Jardin du Luxembourg and the RER is less than 10mn walk to the hotel. The street is quiet and if you want more quiet you can ask for a room on the interior. A 2 star hotel worth 5 stars. Louise from Saint-Sauveur.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 2 Star Hôtel with 5 Star Service in heart of Paris !”
Reviews.Author: Chansonette
Reviews.Content: Excellent 2 Star Hôtel with 5 Star Service in heart of Paris ! Thanks to Trip Advisor, I discovered this excellent and comfortable hôtel in the heart of the Latin Quarter, located 1 minutes from the Pantheon and a quick walk down the hill to Boulevard St. Germain and metro Maubert Mutualité or a 7 minute walk from metro St. Michel. It's also close to the Seine, Musée de Cluny, Notre Dame, l'Institut Arabe, many affordable restaurants and cafés and practical conveniences including a stationery shop, small grocers (right on the rue des Carmes) dry cleaner, laundromat, phone store, pharmacie, banks, post office, (7 min walk on the rue des Ecoles) and much more. Markets are held by the metro Maubert Mutualité several mornings a week and sell various things: flowers, foods,cheese, nuts, as well as a variety of scarves (great light gifts) and clothing, The best thing (beyond the fine location) about the hotel which put "the icing on the cake" was the wonderful staff who worked hard to make sure our needs were met and made many helpful suggestions to us, which enhanced our trip and helped us get to and fro locations, including the airport, efficiently. Their superb reputation, already recorded in Trip Advisor, led me to try the hôtel and I was not disappointed. Whether or not you spoke French was no problem and the staff all tried hard to make sure we were having a happy and comfortable stay. They also had a little fridge which we used quite often to store perishable food (e.g. for picnics) A simple breakfast of coffee or tea with bread and croissant and jam is offered for an additional supplement. The rooms are comfortably furnished in a practical style and very clean - beds are comfortable and our double had a clean and pleasant bathroom equipped with a large bathtub and separate toilet. Both my friend and I slept well there and our room on the courtyard was quiet most of the time, with occasional possiblilites for eavesdropping on noise from other guests living on the courtyard. I would definitely stay at the Hôtel des Carmes if I can get a room, be sure to reserve ahead, esp in holiday periods, they are quite popular !

Reviews.Title: “great little find and good value for paris”
Reviews.Author: IrishGirl-late20s
Reviews.Content: a few metres from teh metro makes this a really attractive hotel. nothing really stands out about it, but it was quite cheap, the staff were friendly and i really liked the location. Be warned, if you're offered Room 1 on the bottom floor (even though it goes at a cheaper rate), you wont sleep a wink. Other rooms are perfect though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and staff - basic accomodations”
Reviews.Author: LFA
Reviews.Content: Location can't be beat for convenience to metro, restaurants and the key sights in Paris. Terrific Latin Quarter location and an historic building thrown in as an extra. Read FOOTPRINTS IN PARIS for a good history of the Quarter and this hotel. That said, the accomodations themselves are very basic and rooms would compare to a Motel 6 or Microtel in USA, that is to say, clean and serviceable, but no extras (except that air conditioning is a plus in a 2 star hotel). Staff is very pleasant and all strove to be helpful in any way possible. When asked about a nearby town and an attraction there, 1 of the staff volunteered that he lived there and would be happy to meet us at the train station and provide a ride to that destination. Continental breakfast was very basic, but could be supplemented with fruits from nearby markets. Rooms had low beds (mattresses on slatted bases, with no box spring or foundation so initially one felt close to the floor. The room, a triple, had a tiny closet and no dresser (just a small shelf on each side of thebed and a tiny desk with a straight-backed wooden chair) . To be fair, other rooms used by family members had larger closets. Essentially, you will live out of your suitcase. No room safes are provided. Toiletries included towels and soap, but no shampoo or washcloths. On a price/value basis, this is an outstanding choice but I would probably opt for more amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Room for Improvement but good backup choice in Latin Quarter-great a/c”
Reviews.Author: DisneyParis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night-1 June 2010. My cousin had a single room #105 with bath, and her only complaint was getting in the room due to her lock’s difficulty. Our room #106 had a twin bed and a double bed, a tv, a bureau, and a small table with telephone. The tv was great and received many channels including several in English such as CNN. There was a separate room for the toilet and another for the tub/shower combo and the sink. Soap/shampoo was provided, I think. Everything was clean. One very big plus for this hotel was the a/c. It worked beautifully and cooled the room down it minutes-mainly humid and not that hot when we were there, but a great asset. The fire alarm went off just after we arrived and was a nuisance. I thought the hotel had free wifi (I thought I saw it only their French website, but I can’t find it now so maybe I was looking at the Hotel des Carmes in Rouen? They said theirs was 2 euros for 30 minutes. There was no safe so I carried my valuables with me to dinner. The woman at the front desk when we checked in was a bit curt, but perhaps it was because it was the end of her shift. Everyone else was ok. One complaint on check-in was that we had to fill out the form with our passport, address, etc. This practice ended about a decade ago, but some hotels still are in the past. I didn’t have to do it anywhere else in France and haven’t done it on most of my previous 20 visits either. Join the 21st century please. The hotel lobby was clean and the elevator and stairs were as they should be. The front entrance was just 50m up the hill from the twice weekly market. The location of the hotel was fantastic- just down from the Pantheon and close to the wonderful restaurants-especially La Harpe-and others near Church St. Severin. Also, decent priced tacky souvenirs in that same area. This was the second best hotel I’ve stayed at in the Latin Quarter area. If it’s available, stay two blocks away at the Hotel du College de France on Rue Ternes. I like to try out new hotels, and one day will return to those I really like. I recommended the HCF to my friend’s potential grandson-in-law, and he and her granddaughter stayed there just before New Year’s and were treated very special and invited to share dessert and champagne with the staff at their party even though they knew no French. I would consider staying at the Hotel des Carmes again as the prices were good but probably won’t. The breakfast was just bread, coffee, and cold cuts. Juice was extra! There was a computer station off the breakfast room which I did use for a few minutes. Not sure if that one is free or the lady before got off with some time remaining. I don’t think it’s anything extra special, but it was safe and clean and fairly priced. They need to add free wifi, put a safe in each room, and add at least boiled eggs and juice to the breakfast selection. Thanks TripAdvisor for recommending this as a good budget selection-I give it an above average, but just slightly, overall rating.

Reviews.Title: “A Bijou in the 5th!”
Reviews.Author: AnatoleFrance
Reviews.Content: The Hotel des Carmes exceeded our expectations. We've stayed nearby for several times the price, or paid twice as much in despicable lodgings. Four nights at the HDC and we were delighted with the deal. The HDC is not only a bargain, it's a genuine pleasure. The staff were warm, helpful, forgiving of our faults and attentive to our needs. We were lucky to have the night man schedule our shuttle to CDG which went flawlessly on the day we left. The HDC is convenient, close to a Metro stop, on an historic rue that looks up at the Panthéon, in a very cool neighborhood. What's not to like? There are even low-price, take-out establishments in the block that will save you money if you want to pique-nique or eat pizza and sip cheap wine in your room. I have nothing to say but good things for these folks. Hotel des Carmes. Six étoiles, if only they were allowed. ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very nice staff, small room”
Reviews.Author: Nati_Traveler1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed the first few days in May. Our travel was based on the tripadvisor reviews as well as the location of the property. We were incredibly pleased at the location of the hotel. We couldnt of asked for anything better for the price. The rooms were small, but expected so didnt dissapoint at all. Everything was clean, great staff, very helpful. There is a little Italian restaurant if you turn left out of the hotel, that was fantastic for the price. We absolutely loved it there. We would absolutely recommend staying here for anyone sacrificing room size for location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Basic room.”
Reviews.Author: bluebfalo
Reviews.Content: We were able to book 2 rooms for 4 nights for 760 Euros. This is a wonderful little hotel in a great location. Easy access to the metro (Maubert station) and RER (St. Michel/Notre Dame). Minutes from Notre Dame, St. Chappelle and Ile de St. Louis. Walking distance to the Louvre and Jardin des Tuileries. Close to Boulanger Patissier (about 3 houses away) and an internet cafe (milk). We were able to check in early and leave our bags in the lobby. When we returned from a day of sightseeing, our bags were still in the lobby. The elevator was small, but easily fit a family of 4 with our luggage). The rooms were basic, but quiet and comfortable. The bed was a little on the firm side and the covers a little thin and worn (think holiday inn/motel quality). The temperature could be easly control via a panel in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Price, location and cleanliness was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Lindz-M
Reviews.Content: Came here with my husband...and it was perfect! It was clean (and my husband is very particular!!!) The cost was unbeatable compared to other hotels in downtown convenient location, and the staff was always friendly and helpful. The rooms were VERY basic and bathrooms small. But, if you come to Paris to hang in your room-- you are missing out!!! We will def. stay here if we come to Paris again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel in a wonderful area of Paris - highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: 1013WesternRanger
Reviews.Content: The hotel is spotlessly clean, excellent value and in an ideal location. I booked 3 nights for my young family in two ajacent rooms and was very pleased with everything from confirmation of my reservation through to the checking out. The hotel is in the middle of a short, pleasant one-way side street so traffic noise is down to a minimum. This is an excellent area of Paris with grocery stores just across the road, an organic bakery just around the corner, cafes, restaurants and the metro all within a minute's walk. The hotel's breakfast is very good value by Parisian standards at 6 euros. The staff were very friendly, helpful and multi-lingual. I chose this hotel after hours of reading reviews on TripAdvisor and was very happy with the result. I would certainly stay there again for its quality, value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Eloise_8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a wonderful location - five minutes to Notre Dame, great restaurants nearby and a local market on the corner. Our room was simple but perfectly adequate, with a view over the street to a lovely old building opposite. The service, also, was friendly and helpful. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were basic. Service was exceptional.”
Reviews.Author: Christina1984
Reviews.Content: At the high cost of traveling to Paris, it's tough to find a clean and friendly hotel for reasonable cost. We had a room for three people, which cost us approximately. 80 Euros/night. The rooms were basic, but we didn't anything more. Now, the exceptional service: My husband and I managed to have left a white envelop consisting of our passport, e-tickets, and 900 Euros. We didn't notice it was missing until we were on the train to St. Wandrille-Rancon. At our first stop in Rouen, we phoned the front desk at the hotel. She didn't speak very good English, nor did we speak any French, so it was difficult to communicate. Although, we seemed to understand that she wanted us to call back in thirty minutes after she looks into it. After a long agonizing 30 minutes of thinking it's gone, we phone. She is pleased to tell us she has the envelope. While on the phone with us, she goes through the contents and counts the money to ensure that it is all there. We were unable to communicate well enough to explain where and how to send the envelope, so we asked her to keep it. She assured us it would be in a safe at the hotel. When we arrived in St. Wandrille-Rancon, we stayed a monastery where the munk my family knew spoke fluent English and French. He phoned the hotel and had them send the envelop by courrier. We received the package the next morning. I have heard so many horror stories when traveling of money going missing. This was quite the opposite. They made the extra effort to ensure that we got our money and information back. We greatly appreciate it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: johnrogerChicago_Il_
Reviews.Content: Very clean and in a fantastic location - can't beat it for the price. As expected, rooms are small, beds aren't the most comfortable... but a good budget hotel pick when traveling with a group.

Reviews.Title: “Good value clean hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: DazamAustralia
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice, 3 years apart, and have recommended it to friends who have also gone back a second time. We have stayed in other hotels in Paris but went back to Hotel Des Carmes because the location is so so good and because the hotel is "fine" that is, small rooms (but for Paris, average size), clean, reasonably quiet, pleasant and helpful staff, nice lobby to wait in and in a nice street. The photos on the internet are accurate. The hotel is in a very nice area within walking distance of many of the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, okay room”
Reviews.Author: savoystar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. The location in the Latin Quarter is perfect: right next to a Metro station where there is a street market three times a week, and a short walk to the Saint Michel Notre Dame RER. Our room was small but reasonably clean, though the window got relatively little daylight (it faced an interior skylight). There was no street noise, though noise from the hallway and other rooms was noticeable (but usually not a problem). Towels felt cheap and we suspected the sheets were not changed unless we asked for it - no big deal though. Most surprising was that shampoo was not provided, and the tiny pieces of soap were not restocked until we asked the fourth day (and even then somewhat grudgingly). I don't know if it's normal to bring your own soap to Parisian hotels, but this came as a surprise to us. They can't be worth more than 10 cents each. The hair dryer was an industrial vacuum cleaner style unit that became uncomfortably hot to hold, and, like any old vacuum cleaner, the handle slipped off from time to time. These are probably due for replacement. There was a modern and efficient AC unit, which was nice for clearing the steam after a hot shower. Service was polite but not especially friendly, aside from one fellow named Tony who apparently was leaving. At least we got most of our questions answered (though they did not offer many restaurant suggestions). Amazingly the one time we asked, the receptionist did not know the weather forecast. It seemed odd to have 5 different receptionists during our stay, but maybe this is not unusual. We had breakfast only one morning, because we were in a hurry - it was fine, but there are plenty of cheaper and better options nearby. Overall this hotel fell slightly below expectations in terms of value, but then value is hard to find in this city.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and extremely well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: chebourashka
Reviews.Content: Hotel des Carmes is a very clean hotel. There is an elevator. The room and the bathroom were relatively big. The bathroom had a big window and was really clean. The room was simple, but very functional. It had one double bed and one single bed. The closet was big. They added AC. We didn't need it as it was quite cold in September. It was a bit difficult to find the hotel. The taxi driver spent some time to find out as some big streets were closed because the Pope arrived the same day in Paris. The taxi driver didn't charge extra for that. Our room had a french balcony and a view to the street. At one end of the street we could see the Pantheon. The hotel is a simple place, but the location is excellent. We could walk to Notre Dame in less than 3 minutes, same for Pantheon. There are several fruit stores on the same street selling wine and other things. A big supermarket was close on Monge street. The hotel street is quiet, but it is very close to the restaurants and bistros in the 5th, and also numerous places for food to go. It was very pleasant walking in old streets and having dinner in that area. The hotel is also very close to the metro Maubert-Mutualite. We found an Internet point on one of the streets on the way to Notre Dame. We didn't take a breakfast at the hotel, but there are many bakeries and pastry stores in that area. There was also a street Market. We had our breakfast at the Eric Keyser pastry store close by. Last time we stayed in the 9th, but we were happy to stay in the 5th this time particularly with a child. Hotel personnel was very helpful and nice. When we arrived the welcome was really warm. When leaving, the receptionist tried for a long time to get us a shuttle, but finally recommended a taxi for the three of us, as it was too late for a shuttle. One morning I opened the French window in our room and was just amazed by the view, as the sky was light pink and gray and the clouds looked golden (This is only in Paris, and no I was not dreaming: la vie en rose). I was scared to move and to lose that vision, so I stayed by the window watching it for 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and relatively affordable”
Reviews.Author: lukmi
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location, metro is 50 m away, Pantheon 100 m, Notre Dame 5 min walk, Quiet, clean and neat. Cons: Small bed, small room. All in all, I'd recommend it cos for about than 100 euros a night we had everything we needed at our doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “great location and price”
Reviews.Author: hanid
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four days. One block to the Metro station. The Pantheon is at the other end of the street. The hotel was clean, quiet and in a great neighborhood. We don't really care about amenities - we wanted a safe quiet place to sleep at the end of the day. There are good inexpensive restaurants nearby, fruit stand across the street and a great bakery 2 blocks away (Kayser). We walked to Notre Dame easily, past interesting shops and cute restaurants. The Pantheon was a great discovery for our family - what an interesting place in Parisien history! We would definitely stay here again and recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “a very clean, quiet, well located hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TVOWexford
Reviews.Content: Before our trip we had done a little research to find a nice central located hotel.We decided to book Hotel Carmes for our first night only and decided to wait and see what exactly the hotel was like before booking for the rest of our trip, as we had heard so many horror stories about accomadation in Paris. We were not dissapointed. Our 3 night stay was very comfortable. Each day our room was tidied and clean towels put out. The staff were more than helpful and friendly, even when we fell in the door at 4 in the morning after a great night in the Latin Quarter. This is a great little hotel. A real gem.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MariaDantas
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect: near metro Maubert and walking distance to Notredame. Very clean and with a friendly staff. I stayed there in Jan 2008 for 5 nights and in Oct 2006 for 5 nights. I booked direct to the hotel (by fax). For breakfast, you have many options near the hotel. When we talk about Paris, considering hotel prices, average of 90 euros is very cheap for this hotel location (Quartier Latin) and conditions. Hotel rooms are not big but it is ok (normal in Paris). Near the hotel we have cafeterias, restaurants, shoppings etc. I recommend this hotel and I will probably return in my next trip to Paris. Great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: szardos
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms were small, they were very clean and very comfortable. My room had air conditioning, CNN (in English) and good closet space. Tiny bathroom but it served my needs and I was able to take leisurely hot showers. The staff is extremely friendly to all nationalities and they are protective of guests (you must leave your key at the desk even to go outside for a smoke). I never felt unsafe. If you want directions, a shuttle to the airport or any other information, they are there to assist you. I can't say enough about how pleasant the staff is. The location is great. It's in the heart of the Latin Quarter. Outside the hotel you can see the breath-taking Pantheon in the distance, which is akin to a Hollywood backdrop. Notredame Cathedral is just a few blocks away. The area is also filled with cafes, shops, and easy-access to metro and busses. This is not a five-star hotel (not even four-star), but for someone like me who experienced their first trip to Paris, it was the perfect affordable, American-friendly place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great value, friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: gordonbs
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights from 23rd March 2008. Basic hotel, but very clean, with friendly, helpful staff. Triple room quite small, but very adequate for our needs at 137 Euroi per night. Hotel has a lift and basic 6 Euro breakfast, which is fine. You can pay a fortune for hotels in Paris, but this time we were on a budget and this hotel was ideal, in a great area near to Notre Dame, the Sorbonne, Latin Quarter, and an easy walk down the Boulevard St Germain to some great cafes and restaurants, such as the Polidor Cremerie and Bouillon Racine. If you prefer to picnic, the little square at the junction of Rue de Carmes and Rue de Ecoles, about 100m down from the hotel has a market some mornings and a row of fantastic shops that sell all the fresh produce and wine that you will need to eat and drink. I would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: magicfeet
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 9 days and are very satisfied with the experience. The room was very basic and tiny (as expected) but clean. The staff went out of their way to make our stay as pleasant as possible -- whether it be giving directions to sites, instructing us on how to navigate the Metro, or pointing us to a nice brasserie in the neighborhood. Merci beaucoup to Luc who was incredibly patient and good-humored with us despite our endless requests! Besides the excellent staff, what makes this hotel special is its unbeatable location. It is half a block from a Metro stop, a fine wine shop, fromagerie, poissonerie, charcuterie, cremerie, boulangerie, pattiserie, a few brasseries, and other "ries" you can think of. It is also only a 5-minute walk from Notredame Cathedral. What more, there is a street market every other day right by the Metro stop, where you can pick up fresh fruits or an inexpensive pashmina! I would recommend this to any traveller who wishes a basic, centrally located, efficiently-run hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for a very good price”
Reviews.Author: Kot79
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this lovely hotel on our honeymoon trip for a 10 nights. I have made quite an extended research on Paris's hotels in price range of <100EUR and according to all reviews - it was the best. After staying there I can say that is one of the best hotels for its price category in Paris. First of all - the location: its simply perfect! 3 minutes of walking to Notre Dame and Conciergerie; 3 minutes to the Pantheon; wide selection of public transportation (buses and metro stations are 2 minutes of walking). Secondly, very kind, helpful and cheerful stuff (and most important - good and accurate English speaking). Thirdly, clean, nice, cozy rooms with a very good view (at least our room was) (though a bit small). Bottom line - we strongly recommend this hotel to every one who wants to feel a real Parisian atmosphere and stay in a very good hotel for a very good money value!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel, clean and quiet room”
Reviews.Author: Panumas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel on May 8-15, 2007. It's a real good hotel, well located. Our room (double standard) was very clean and very quiet. After a long walk around Paris each day, we got a perfect sleep every single night. I guess the room is soundproof. I highly recommend this hotel to whose who are light sleepers. One more important thing, the staffs are very nice and very helpful. Long live Hotel des Carmes! I'll go back t there again, am sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TravellingWilburys
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel De Carmes for 5 nights. The rate was good and the location was excellent. The staff spoke english well and were most helpful. The Hotel was recently refurbished so every thing was very clean and up to date. A couple of downsides - the rooms are quite small and it can be difficult to turn around in the bathroom. The rooms are not air conditioned and with the weather in Europe warming up they could become an oven. We will go back to Paris as it is amazing, but if temp is over 23 will need aircon rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A magic place o stay”
Reviews.Author: Annzie
Reviews.Content: My mother and I had a wonderful time in Paris and loved staying at the Hotel des Carmes. The room was very comfortable and quiet not sure if it was double glazed windows but when we shut them there was no noise from the street and we were in a street side room. We could see Notre Dame to the right and the Pantheon to the left. The staff were extremely helpful with tips and the best ways to get around. It was close to so many sights and transport. I would definetly stay there again. My husband, sister and friends have all stayed there previously and loved it too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned Paris. The hotel is nice and clean. We had room 522 with a balcony street side. Next time we would like to try the courtside room. Overall was great the staff was very helpful and nice. we will stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel des Carmes
